lexUnit.name: argue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: exchange diverging or opposite views heatedly.

sentence.text: Finally the clock struck three , then four , finally Francis and Jamie lurched down the stairs arguing about how late the late night bars stayed open or had they got the energy to visit the Heath .
They argued angrily over who was the real ` Prince of Sleaze " for running commercials attacking the other 's honesty .
Mr and Mrs Popple always argued at least once a week .
They argued endlessly about it .
Three generations have passed through this room , slept here , argued here , made love here , even died here .
Auction houses and buyers argue over compensation
One can argue whether or not one-party patronage , as in Britain , is even worse .
I opened my mouth to argue but he was walking away .
It was a general point , we were not arguing .
On and on the battle had raged ; on and on they 'd argued , neither giving an inch .
` We tried to encourage the people to work with each other , and talk to politicians , because they argued a lot about what they were going to do all the time , " he said .
` You ca n't argue politics with foreigners , " sighed the policeman .
Legend has it that on the orders of Emperor Maxentius , fifty philosophers attempted to argue the religious facts with her .
I argued this point with him , but he was obdurate in the matter .
He was going to take any opportunity he could to get her off his team , so there was little point in her trying to argue her case with him .
` You dare to argue the Holy Bible with me ?
Whenever I have argued this point with other anglers they inevitably say that all you need to do is use a long link and a short hook-length when link-legering to obtain the same effect .

Wallaby skipper Nick Farr-Jones argues the toss with Scottish referee Ken McCartney -- but will his competitive instincts see him through a gruelling campaign as the World Champions take on South Africa this summer ?
He translated for us and it was only after he had argued our case with the Head of Austrian Customs that we started to get somewhere .
We have been arguing the point with the inspector at claims branch for many many months and we just seem to go round in circles .
Rachel does n't argue about coming to London .
Anne says they argue about ringing the bell .
` The reason a lot of women and men argue without hearing each other is that many women lack the bottom harmonics in their voices , while men do n't allow themselves the upper harmonics .
They argued amicably over who should pay .
It 's not the time to argue about the small print of your contract .
Behind him on the back seats of the bus four teenagers argued loudly over the cost of the litre of cider and half bottle of vodka they passed between them .
Whereas they eventually came to some agreement over the various ` courses " , they argued vehemently over Elisabeth 's insistence that the recital should both begin and close with Strauss 's Morgen .
International : Deputies argue over Russia 's new name
It is unwise ever to argue with a guide .
Once or twice , Ken argued with him and said : ` There was a pause there .
And Jessamy knew better than to argue with him when he used that particular tone of voice .
Nevertheless , there are always some cowboys who like to argue with all and sundry , including their horse .
Ellen was still arguing with me as Thessy and I climbed in and backfired away , but I was no longer listening .
Tepilit and his brother can be seen arguing with the others .
You did n't argue with White Feet or Red Cloud because he knew best .
Lili could see Stan Valance arguing with Zimmer .
During those first few weeks Richard and Hudson were inseparable , racing with each other to get to the office in the mornings , arguing about who would lock the door at night .
They were arguing about who had the softest fabric and I was called in as arbitrator .
